content: on your us size 7 4 5 mm or smaller needles you should have 152 168 178 190 204 216 228 240 252 268 stitches on your needles with rs facing join in new yarn and place bor marker the ws of the collar will be shown when worn work in 1x1 rib k1 p1 for 11 in 28 cm or until you reach your preferred length when folded over the collar is intended to be approximately 1 in 1 5 cm longer on the rs so that the transition from stockinette to the ribbing is hidden bind off using italian bind-off or your preferred stretchy cast off method make sure to bind off loosely if you are using the italian bind-off optional if you would like to add more stability to your collar and prevent it from stretching out you can add elastic thread on the ws of the collar where it transitions from the ribbing to the yoke you can do this by weaving the elastic thread under the knit stitches a tutorial is linked in the techniques section em knits © copyright 2025 6 the regina pullover sleeves you will now work the sleeves of the sweater the length of the sleeves are intended to reach past your wrist and partially onto the hand but you can opt to knit shorter sleeves by omitting a few rounds before the cuffs with your us size 8 5 mm needles starting at the center of the bottom of the armhole pick up and knit 5 7 8 10 11 12 14 17 17 19 st one in every cast on stitch place the sleeve stitches you previously had on hold back on your needles and knit around pick up another 6 7 8 11 12 12 15 17 18 19 st one in every cast on stitch you should now have 51 56 60 67 71 76 85 90 97 104 st on your needles place
